title: Self-Regulated E-Feedback Utilization Program to Enhance Academic Performance for Multicultural University Students

context.prior_knowledge: Basic-level proficiency in digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Multicultural learner group comprising professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields. Progressing through asynchronous learning via LMS in a digital-device-provided environment.

learning_goals: Learners can establish academic performance plans with over 80% accuracy using self-regulated e-feedback strategies
Learners can apply at least three collaborative learning strategies reflecting collectivist cultural characteristics in e-learning environments
Learners can execute risk-taking attempts four or more times when solving tasks based on strategic learning approaches
Learners can implement deep learning approaches (in-depth analysis, critical thinking) in over 70% of assignments through e-feedback
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
